On 3 Dec, three people were injured when cow vigilantes clashed with police as they attempted to block the Jammu-Pathankot highway near Dayalachak village (Kathua, J&K). The rioters were demonstrating after a truck containing bovines was found and torched in nearby Pathwal village.
On 3 Dec, cow vigilantes torched a truck carrying bovines at Pathwal village (Kathua, J&K). The truck's conductor and driver managed to escape without being harmed.

On December 3, a man was beaten by a group of people near Gaushala municipality (Mahottari district, Janakpur), alleging him of being involved in sorcery and using black magic. The victim's son was also injured while he was trying to protect the victim.

On December 3, traders and shopkeepers of Katchery Bazaar demonstrated by blocking road, chanting slogans and torching banners in Faisalabad city (Faisalabad, Punjab) against alleged kidnapping of two local businessmen by a group of lawyers.

On December 3, villagers clashed over a Facebook post in Gurupali village under Dhanakauda block area (Sambalpur, Odisha). The post was about the stopping of water supply from Sasan canal to their village.

On December 3rd, students demonstrated in Mombasa against the impostion of what are described as "tough sudden rules" by the University of Mombasa administration. The students blockaded roads and damaged vehicles, and then threw stones at police, who responded by firing live rounds in the air, dispersing the demonstrators.
On December 3rd, demonstrators blocked roads with burning tires at Caldwell (Monrovia), in protest at the lack of electricity in the neighbourhood. Police dispersed the demonstrators with tear gas.

03 December. Students of Bowen University in Iwo demonstrated against mandated drug testing by the university. A video circulated on-line depicted a dorm building that had been set on fire in opposition to the policy. However, the school said that the video was fake and students had only set fire to a mattress.
On December 3, some students and youths burned tires and carried out other acts of vandalism in protest against teachers exams boycott in Bouhajla.
On December 3, students in Hammamet threw stones at teachers in Bir Bou Rekba in protest against teachers boycott of exams, forcing schools to close.
On December 3, students protested and threw stones at teachers in Tabarka for boycotting exams.
On December 3, students protested and threw stones at teachers in Fernana for boycotting exams.
On December 3, students burned tires and threw stones in the area of Bou Argoub in protest against teachers boycotting exams.
On December 2, in Edjeba town, PDP and APC youth members clashed after one group was accused of being spies. At least one person was seriously injured.
On 2 December, rioters in Raffour blocked the RN15 road wih burning tires to call for the provision of natural gas to their social housing units.

assoc_actor_1: Labour Group (Libya); Former Military Forces of Libya (2012-2014)
source: Al Naba; Libya Al Hadath; Al Marsad; Libya Observer
notes: On December 2, former workers of foreign companies that left Libya and war veterans destroyed a part of the outer fence and stormed the headquarters of the presidential council in Tripoli, demanding for years unpaid salaries.

02 December. During the weekend, political militias attacked an APC meeting at the home of the former Minister of Commerce in Gwaram and attempted to lynch the minister. Security forces fired into the air and evacuated the former minister while the attackers destroyed vehicles. Four people were injured during the clash and ten suspects were later arrested.

On 2/12/2016, anti-regime rioters who are part of the agitation led by the February 14 Youth Coalition, blocked a street in Maamir with burning tyres to denounce death sentences and demand the release of political prisoners.

On 2/12/2016, anti-regime rioters who are part of the agitation led by the February 14 Youth Coalition, blocked a street in Abu Saybi with burning tyres to denounce the death sentences and demand the release of political prisoners.

On Dec 02, protesters demonstrated outside West Qurna 2 oilfield, calling for jobs and the establishment of a hospital for treating cancer, clashing with police forces resulting in the injury of some demonstrators.
On Dec 2, 20 people including five policemen were injured when police tried to stop several thousand workers of a garment factory from agitating in BSCIC industrial area of Fatullah in Narayanganj.
On Dec 2, activists of the Awami League clashed with police in Bianibazar in Sylhet city after police intercepted a protest rally against Education Minister Nurul Islam Nahid.
On Dec 2, relatives of Congress worker who died in police custody, staged a demonstration and pelted stones at police, injuring two, in Amritsar (Punjab).
On Dec 2, a mob beat two men for allegedly molesting two women including one minor in Aman Vihar (New Delhi).

On December 2, a 35-year-old mentally challenged man was lynched by a mob at Nagra village under Mandar police station area (Ranchi, Jharkhand), soon after he killed two villagers. The victim picked up a fight with the duo after some cattle entered his agriculture field. He was known for being violent and was being treated for a mental disorder.

On December 2, a 25-year-old man was beaten and burnt to death by a group of men in Oralhiya village under Sahiyara police station area (Sitamarhi, Bihar). The man had eloped with the daughter-in-law of an influential man of the area, married her and then returned to the same village to live together.

On Dec 2, scores of farmers and members of Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) set a bundle of sugarcane ablaze during a demonstration in Shamli (Uttar Pradesh) against the government for failing to fulfill its promise to raise price of the crops to Rs 450 per quintal.
On 2 Dec, local residents blocked the Jammu-Akhnoor road at Batehra village (Jammu, J&K) over alleged counting fraud during the panchayat elections. Demonstrators burnt tyres at the scene.

Assumed on 2 Dec, in Columbuthurai (Jaffna, Jaffna), unidentified rioters vandalized houses of residents for unknown reasons. The source mentioned that the vandalism could have been done by criminal gangs with alleged links with the military.

On 2 December, a group of Economic Freedom Fighters (EFF) members vandalised an outlet of the mobile communications company Vodacom at the Mall of the North in Polokwane. They were protesting over a photograph used by a speaker at the Vodacom Journalist of the Year event the previous week

assoc_actor_1: February 14 Youth Coalition; Shiite Muslim Group (Bahrain)
notes: On 1/12/2016, anti-regime rioters who are part of the agitation led by the February 14 Youth Coalition, blocked a street in Sitrah with burning tyres. They are currently denouncing the death sentence handed down to four Shiite citizens for a 2017 bombing that killed a policeman, and the arrest of Shiite cleric Sheikh Zaki and number of other citizens.

On 1/12/2016, anti-regime rioters who are part of the agitation led by the February 14 Youth Coalition, blocked a street in Maamir with burning tyres. They are currently calling for the boycott of the second round of the election.

On Dec 1, one person was killed in a series of clashes between two factions of Tabligh Jamaat over establishing dominance at the Bishwa Ijtema grounds on the banks of the Turag River in Tongi in Gazipur in Dhaka. Police intervened with water cannons and tear gas. Report did not indicate the rioters were armed.

On Dec 1, nearly 20 persons, including women, raided the Government Senior Secondary School at Kishangarh village, Rohtak district, Haryana, and assaulted three teachers with rods and wodden sticks over assaulting a child earlier.
On December 1, in Vaikom town in Vaikom tehsil (Kottayam, Kerala), two rival groups clashed during an interaction at the Ashtami (Hindu) festival, leaving one person dead.

On December 1, BJD members assaulted a youth held by the police at Saintala city (Bolangir district, Odisha). The youth was detained on charges of hurling eggs during the party's Jana Sampark Padyatra.

assoc_actor_1: BJP: Bharatiya Janata Party; PAAS: Patidar Anamat Andolan Samiti; Patidar Caste Group (India)
notes: On Dec 1, fighting broke out between seven members of Patidar Anamat Andolan Samiti (PAAS) and BJP as well as locals and migrants in Vastral area of Ahmedabad city (Gujarat) during a Goddess Umiya Rath (Hindu relgious) procession. Police intervened and seven members of Patidar Anamat Andolan Samiti (PAAS) were detained and cops resorted to lathicharge.
On 1 Dec, a youth was seriously injured when supporters of a rival political party assaulted him during vote counting in the Kasblari area (Poonch, J&K).
On 1 Dec, stone throwing was reported during a third day of shutdowns in Sopore town (Baramulla, J&K). The shutdown was prompted by the killing of a local militant by state forces.

assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 01 December. The youth leader and another Imbonerakure fought with locals in Gashoho at a local drinking spot.

On December 1, people threw stones at officials who were removing enroachments on agricultural land in Al Teiriya, Behera. A number of members of security forces were injured, some equipment was damaged. 42 people got arrested.

On Dec 1, unidentified men attacked the vehicle carrying a Jatiya Party lawmaker of Sylhet-2, in Burunga area of Osmaninagar upazila. They pelted his vehicle with stones and brick. The lawmaker fired bullets in the air in response.

On Dec 1, the Awami League and the BNP clashed in Sarishabari upazila in Jamalpur. During the clash, three motorbikes were torched and three shops were vandalised. Report did not indicate the men were armed with weapons.
On Dec 1, a Chhatra League activist of Jahangirnagar University at Savar (Dhaka) beat up a female tea stall owner on the campus over payment of dues.

On December 1, local BJP activists assaulted a former minister and CPI (M) state committee member and his supporters in Jirania city (West Tripura, Tripura), while they were on their way to the submission of nomination papers for by-polls to civic bodies. The attackers pelted stones and vandalized four vehicles.

On December 1, locals blocked the Imphal-Yairipok road in Irilbung area in Kalika village (Imphal East, Manipur), by putting timbers, bamboos and empty drums across the road, and burnt tyres. The villagers were demonstrating against the deteriorating condition of the highway.

On December 1, locals blocked the Imphal-Yairipok road in Keirao Khunou in Keirao Bitra tehsil area (Imphal East, Manipur), by putting timbers, bamboos and empty drums across the road, and burnt tyres. The villagers were demonstrating against the deteriorating condition of the highway.

On December 1, students of two colleges in Kolkata city (Kolkata, West Bengal) continued to demonstrate demanding permission to appear in the annual exams despite lacking the required attendance. They staged a road blockade outside Sivanath Sastri College in Gariahat.

On December 1, locals blocked the Imphal-Yairipok road in Langdum Lamkhai village (Imphal East, Manipur), by putting timbers, bamboos and empty drums across the road, and burnt tyres. The villagers were demonstrating against the deteriorating condition of the highway.

On December 1, the CPI-M party office was vandalized by suspected BJP supporters in Shantirbazar city (South Tripura, Tripura). The opposition CPI (M) has been accusing the ruling BJP of violent attacks to prevent them in filing nomination for urban local bodies scheduled on December 22.

On December 1, locals blocked the Imphal-Yairipok road in Chingya Uku and Wangkhem areas (Thoubal, Manipur), by putting timbers, bamboos and empty drums across the road, and burnt tyres. The villagers were demonstrating against the deteriorating condition of the highway.

On 1 Dec, a losing sarpanch candidate and his followers entered the house of another losing candidate, damaged furniture and assaulted the candidate's family members following local elections in Rajdhani village (Rajouri, J&K). The mob had accused the candidate of conspiring with the winning candidate.

assoc_actor_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
notes: 01 December. Lash between UDPS and FCC supporters in Kasai after posters were ripped. Thirty-five people were injured. No arms mentioned.
On 1 December, merchants in Batna blocked roads in the center of Batna with burning tires to denounce a decision by authorities to force-closure 100 shops in the city.
On November 30, an individual seized a weapon from a policeman in Kasserine and attempted to opened fire but was overpowered and arrested.

On or around November 30th, youth groups fought in Bungoma, seemingly over a local political dispute. Police dispersed the rioters using tear gas and live rounds. A number of youth were reported to have been injured in the clashes.
On 30 November, a security guard sustained critical injuries after protesting workers set fire to a building in Boksburg. Several other people were injured and vehicles and property were set alight.

source: Duraz Youth; 14 February Revolution Youth Coalition
notes: On 30/11/2018, anti-regime rioters who are part of the agitation led by the February 14 Youth Coalition, threw Molotov cocktails at security forces in Diraz, who responded by firing rubber bullets.

notes: On 30/11/2016, anti-regime rioters who are part of the agitation led by the February 14 Youth Coalition, blocked a street in Abu Saybi with burning tyres. They are currently denouncing the arrest of Shiite cleric Sheikh Zaki and number of other citizens.

assoc_actor_1: February 14 Youth Coalition; Shiite Muslim Group (Bahrain)
notes: On 30/11/2016, anti-regime rioters who are part of the agitation led by the February 14 Youth Coalition, blocked a street in Kharijiyah with burning tyres. They are currently denouncing the arrest of Shiite cleric Sheikh Zaki and number of other citizens.

source: Agence France Presse; El Nour (Lebanon); MENA English
notes: On Nov 30, Palestinians demonstrated and clashed with Israeli security forces on Friday along the eastern Gaza border. At least 41 Palestinians were wounded by Israeli gunfire, tear gas and rubber bullets.
On Nov 30, clashes erupted between Israeli forces and demonstrators in Al Mughayir town, north of Ramallah city, leading to the Israeli forces firing tear gas at the demonstrators.
On Nov 30, a 28-year-old man, who had allegedly trespassed into a house in outer Delhi's Aman Vihar to steal valuables, was caught and lynched by a mob.

On Nov 30, two groups clashed with each other at Begampur area of Malviya Nagar (New Delhi) over a passage connecting a colony going past land that belongs to a madrassa. According to the police, three people suffered minor injuries in the clash.
On November 30, in Madurai town (Madurai, TN), unidentified actors threw a petrol bomb at a BJP leader's house, causing no injuries but damaging property.

On November 30, students blocked roads and thumped windscreens of cars in Kolkata city (Kolkata district, West Bengal), demanding permission to appear in the annual exams despite lacking the required attendance. Students also smashed the barricades put up by the police.

On Nov 30, villagers attacked and held captive a team of Delhi Police officers at Madhiai village near Meerut (UP). The team had gone to the village in Sardhana area to arrest a group of animal smugglers. Villagers accused them of misbehaving with local women.
On 30 Nov, rioters clashed with state forces (assumed police) in various parts of Shopian district town (J&K) amid a shutdown prompted by the killing of a local militant by state forces.
As reported on November 30, two shopkeepers assaulted the Municipal Committee anti-encroachment team in Old Bazaar near Taxila city (Rawalpindi, Punjab) Injuring one member of the team.

On 30 November, a worker violently attacked the UMT general secretary in one of the agricultural farms of Awlad Ben Hammadi in the suburbs of Sidi Slimane because she participated in the trade union strike.

On November 30, the CPI (M) party office was vandalized by suspected BJP supporters in Gandacherra city (Dhalai, Tripura). The opposition CPI (M) has been accusing the ruling BJP of violent attacks to prevent them in filing nomination for urban local bodies scheduled on December 22.
On November 30, near Mankulam village in Devikulam Tehsil (Idukki, Kerala), a mob attacked a fish vendor because he asked for money for the fish from the mob and they didn't want to pay.

On November 30, in Tirur town (Malappuram, Kerala), students clashed with local residents when the students staged a demonstration and blocked roads in support of a viral social media campaign. Police intervened and dispersed the rioters. Eight people were injured.

29 November. Students of the Community Grammar School in Olodo rioted. One person died during two days of melee between the students and arson at the school (no indication which day they died; coded on 29/11).

On November 29, residents in Ouona barricaded roads and protested against the mining company Semafo who they claim has not fullfilled its promises to provide basic infrastructure, security forces attempted to disperse the protesters by firing teargas.
On November 29th, boda boda (motorcycle taxis) drivers demonstrated in Kericho, resulting in clashes between the drivers and police, reportedly for several hours.
On November 29, students and youths in the Nour area of Kasserine vandalized two schools by throwing stones and molotov cocktails.
On 29/11/2018, anti-regime rioters in Maamir threw Molotov cocktails at security forces, who responded by firing tear gas.

assoc_actor_1: February 14 Youth Coalition; Shiite Muslim Group (Bahrain)
notes: On 29/11/2016, anti-regime rioters who are part of the agitation led by the February 14 Youth Coalition, blocked a street in Eker with a burning trash containers. They are currently denouncing the arrest of Shiite cleric Sheikh Zaki and number of other citizens.

They are currently denouncing the death sentence handed down to four Shiite citizens for a 2017 bombing that killed a policeman, and the arrest of Shiite cleric Sheikh Zaki and number of other citizens.
On 29/11/2016, anti-regime rioters who are part of the agitation led by the February 14 Youth Coalition, threw Molotov cocktails at security forces in Abu Saybi.

On Nov 29, Israeli military forces raided the town of Abu Dis in the vicinity of Al-Quds University and attempted to attack the monument of the martyr Mohammed Lafi, leading to clashes where the Israeli forces fired tear gas towards Palestinians, who responded by throwing stones and empty bottles at the soldiers.
On Nov 29, workers of a garment factory put up barricade at Bhabanipur area of Gazipur on the highway protesting retrenchment of workers.

On 29 Nov, in Jaffna city, an unidentified group hurled Molotov cocktails at a civilian's house at the Yaiman junction, Aariyakulam, causing extensive damages to two three wheelers, a motor cycle and a bicycle. The reason for the attack is under investigation but police believe it to be of a personal dispute.
On Nov 29, around 1,200 workers of the Hipad Technology India in Sector 63 in Noida (UP) started rioting after 200 workers were layed off.

On November 29, locals blocked roads and burnt tyres in Pakaridayal area (East Champaran district, Bihar), after a local Rashtriya Lok Samata Party (RLSP) leader was shot dead on November 28. The RLSP supporters shouted slogans against the government and demanded the arrest of the killers.

assoc_actor_1: SFI: Students Federation of India; AISF: All India Students Federation; Students (India)
notes: On November 29, in Kollam town (Kollam, Kerala), Students Federation of India (SFI), Kerala Students Union (KSU), and the All India Students Federation (AISF) activists staged demonstrations and vandalized property following the death of a student on November 28. Police intervened and dispersed them.
On November 29, in Neyyattinkara town (Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala), students from rival secondary schools clashed over the results of Revenue District Kalolsavam. Five students were injured.
On Nov 29, a police constable was killed by unidentified men in Rohini, New Delhi. No further detailes reported.
On 29 Nov, rioters burnt tyres and erected barricades in the Baghat Kanipur area (Budgam, J&K) during demonstrations against the killing of LeT commander, Naveed Jatt.

On 29 Nov, three people received pellet-related injuries when rioters clashed with state forces (assumed police) in the Botingoo area (Baramulla, J&K) during local elections. The clash began when rioters threw stones at state forces and polling staff as they attempted to leave the polling station.

actor2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Reserve Police Force
notes: On 29 Nov, mourners clashed with CRPF troops at Brabandna village (Pulwama, J&K) when they began confiscating mobile phones and identity cards during funerary prayers for a slain militant.
On 29 Nov, rioters burnt tyres and erected barricades in the Chadoora area (Budgam, J&K) during demonstrations against the killing of LeT commander, Naveed Jatt.
On 29 Nov, mourners clashed with state forces (assumed police) at Malangpur village (Awantipora, J&K) when they were prevented from participating in funerary prayers for a slain militant.
On 29 Nov, youths assaulted a Hurriyat leader after he allegedly insulted a local religious leader while delivering an anti-India speech in Qaimoh (Kulgam, J&K).
On 29 Nov, rioters clashed with police in Sopore town (Baramulla, J&K) during the funeral procession for a slain militant.
On 29 Nov, five people were injured when they were attacked by a mob as they returned from vote counting during local elections in Sunderbani town (Rajouri, J&K).

actor2: Police Forces of Indonesia (2014-) Prison Guards
notes: On November 29, 2018, in Lambaro town (Aceh Besar, Aceh), about 113 prisoners escaped from prison after engaging in a riot caused by stronger regulations imposed by the prison board. Prison rioters damaged the prison with barbells from the gym facilities after they threw water at the guards. There were no injuries reported.

On November 29, lawyers forcibly stopped work at sessions drugs courts and Arazi Record Centre (ARC) before staging a demonstration rally in Faisalabad city (Faisalabad, Punjab) continuing their protest (16th day) demanding the establishment of a Lahore High Court (LHC) bench in Faisalabad.

On November 29, a man and his son were assaulted and beaten by a mob in his house at Langol Ningthou Leikai area in Lamphelpat city (Imphal West, Manipur), on charge that he failed to hand over his youngest son accused in an alleged molestation case the day before.

On November 29, ABVP members assaulted a JDU student wing leader (Divyanshu Bhardwaj) outside Patna Women's College in the city (Patna, Bihar), during campaigning for the Patna University Students' Union (Pusu).

29 November. Students of the Community Grammar School in Olodo rioted. One person died during two days of melee between the students and arson at the school (no indication which day they died; coded on 29/11).

On November 29, a Naxalite belonging to Jharkhand Jan Mukti Parishad (JJMP) was lynched for attempting to rape a woman in Irgu village (Palamu, Jharkhand). A large number of villagers rushed to the victim's house as she screamed when the man attacked her.
On November 26, students protested in Gafsa against teachers boycotting exams, several vehicles belonging to teachers were damaged.

On November 28, an altercation took place in Nabeul between residents and security forces, the residents protested and demanded that the governorate consolidate their rights after falling victims to flooding.

assoc_actor_2: PPRD: Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
notes: On November 28, in Kisangani city (Tshopo, Orientale), youth motorcycle taxi riders and students from the High Institute of Building and Public works who are against the ruling party vandalized the office of the ruling party and assaulted its members, leaving them injured.

On 28/11/2016, anti-regime rioters who are part of the agitation led by the February 14 Youth Coalition, blocked a street in Nuwaidrat with burning tyres. They are currently calling for the boycott of the second round of the election.

source: Associated Press International; Times of Israel
notes: On Nov 28, hundreds of ultra-Orthodox Jews have blocked main roads in Jerusalem to demonstrate against the arrest of a community member for refusing to register for the country's military service. Demonstrators brought traffic to a standstill as they blocked the Jerusalem rail service and Jaffa junction, sitting on the train tracks singing and chanting: "We will die and not be drafted,". Police and demonstrators clashed in the streets and 30 demonstrators were arrested.
On Nov 28, two BNP men were injured in a internal scuffle when BNP leader Mojibor Rahaman Sorwar was submitting his nomination papers for the elections in Barisal city.

On Nov 28, at least 20 BNP men were injured in an intra-party clash at Tongibari upazila while the party nomination aspirant for Munshiganj-2, Mizanur Rahman Sinha, was on his way to submit nomination papers. Report did not indicate if the groups were armed.

On November 28, in Malappuram town (Malappuram, Kerala), a group Hindu nationalists assaulted a man after he expressed solidarity with three young women who had publicly spoken of their desire to visit the Sabarimala temple.

On November 28, in Bhopal city (Bhopal, MP), BJP and Congress supporters clashed while BJP workers objected to an attempt to continue the voting even after the limit expired. Two Congress workers were injured.
On November 28, near Jhabua town (Jhabua, MP), a group of unidentified actors threw rocks at a polling party on a bus for unknown reasons, leaving an official injured.

On Nov 28, two people were injured in a scuffle that broke out between the Congress and BJP workers during a demonstration inside Rajpur police station, Dehradun. Congress workers, led by state party chief Pritam Singh, were staging a demonstration at the police station alleging exploitation by the local administration and the BJP-led state government.
On Nov 28, six Dalit students were injured in a clash between two groups following an argument at a college in Muzaffarnagar district, UP.
On Nov 28, a man was lynched by a mob near a tea garden in Malbazar area (Jalpaiguri, WB) on suspicion that the police had released him and one other in connection with the killing of a youth.

assoc_actor_2: Students (India); AITYC: All India Trinamool Youth Congress
notes: On November 28, Trinamul Congress Chhatra Parishad supporters clashed on the campus of Behala College in Kolkata city (Kolkata district, West Bengal), as different groups were staging protests. There had been protests on the campus since the administration announced that 200 students who had fallen short of the required attendance would not be allowed to take the internal test.
On 28 Nov, students clashed with police and CRPF at IUST in Awantipora town (Pulwama, J&K), during demonstrations against that death of LeT commander Naveed Jatt.
On 28 Nov, rioters clashed with state forces (assumed police) at Kakapora village (Pulwama, J&K) as a rumour spread that a slain militant was from the local area.
On 28 Nov, youths clashed with state forces (assumed police) in Pulwama district town (J&K), during demonstrations against that death of LeT commander Naveed Jatt.

On 28 Nov, doctors and hospital staff clashed with patient attendees at the district hospital in Rajouri district town (J&K), following accusations of improper care. Police used a lathicharge to disperse the rioters.
On 28 Nov, students clashed with police at GDC Bemina in Srinagar city (J&K), during a demonstration against the slaying of LeT commander Naveed Jatt.

On November 28, DGH (Y-DGH) reported that some members of the group set a factory on fire in Hadimkoy area of Arnavutkoy district, Istanbul, to demand the end of the confinement imposed on PKK Leader. No information about casualties.
On November 28, locals and family members stormed the residence of a man in Imphal city (Imphal West, Manipur), accused of raping a minor girl. The police intervened to control the mob.
28 November. A mob beat two robbers in Aba to death.

On November 28, students and youths vandalized a school in the Ezzouhour area of Kasserine by throwing stones and molotov cocktails, they clashed with school security guards and wounded several. Police arrested five.
On November 28, suspected students and youths in Tozeur vandalized a school by throwing stones and burning tires at the main entrance.
